column1: Others develop from: - Illnesses such as vitamin K deficiency or severe liver disease - Treatments such as the use of drugs to stop blood clots (anticoagulants) or the long-term use of antibiotics Bleeding disorders can also result from a problem with the number or function of the blood cells that promote blood clotting (platelets).
When the disorders is due to diseases, such as DIC, the outcome will depend on how well the underlying disease can be treated.
